bibl.title: Henry Imhof v. LV Wyckoff. Call for Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in the County of King at Chambers
In the matter of the application of Henry Imhof for a writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: On reading and filing the complaint of Henry Imhof duly signed and verified - Whereby it appears he is illegally restrained of his liberty by LV Wyckoff at Settle in the County of King in the Territory of Washington and stating the cause of said restraint and wherein its illegality consists of which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue and proof of having been made by affidavit that the Hon. Roger S Green, Judge of said 3rd District is absent from the Territory of Washington.

It is therefore ordered that a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the county of King in the Territory of Washington directed to the said LV Wyckoff commanding him to have the body of the said Henry Imhof before me at chambers in the city of Seattle on Monday
the tenth day of November mish at 7 o'clock P.M. and make known the cause of his restraint and to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Henry Imhof and that he have then and there the said writ
div1.ab: John P Hoyt District Judge of 2nd Judicial District in the Territory of Washington
In the District ct King Co In the Matter of the application of Henry Imhof for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Call for Writ Filed November 5th 1881 James Seavey Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
